entry.title: The Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement Act 2007 (Commencement No. 10) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order is the tenth commencement order under the Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement Act 2007 and brings into force the repeal of sections 5 and 8 of the Tribunals and Inquiries Act 1992 (c. 53) which related to recommendations of the Council on Tribunals as to appointment of members of tribunals and procedural rules for tribunals.

entry.title: The Public Bodies (Abolition of Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Public Bodies (Abolition of Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council) Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order abolishes the Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council (AJTC), which was set up by section 44 of the Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement Act 2007. The Schedule makes consequential amendments etc.

title.div: The Free School Lunches and Milk (Universal Credit) (Wales) Order 2013 / Gorchymyn Ciniawau Ysgol a Llaeth am Ddim (Credyd Cynhwysol) (Cymru) 2013

div.p: This Order prescribes, for the purposes of section 512ZB of the Education Act 1996, that where a person or their parent is in receipt of universal credit on or after 6 September 2013, they are within section 512ZB(4).
Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhagnodi, at ddibenion adran 512ZB o Ddeddf Addysg 1996, pan fo person neu ei riant yn cael credyd cynhwysol ar neu ar ôl 6 Medi 2013, ei fod o fewn adran 512ZB(4).

entry.title: The Road Safety (Financial Penalty Deposit) (Appropriate Amount) (Amendment) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Road Safety (Financial Penalty Deposit) (Appropriate Amount) (Amendment) Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order amends the Road Safety (Financial Penalty Deposit) (Appropriate Amount) Order 2009 (the “Principal Order”). The Principal Order specifies the amounts of financial penalty deposits that may be imposed, where certain conditions are met, by constables and vehicle examiners, in relation to offences specified in an order made under section 90A of the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988 (as inserted by section 11 of the Road Safety Act 2006).

title.div: The Adoption Support Services and Special Guardianship (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Gwasanaethau Cymorth Mabwysiadu a Gwarcheidiaeth Arbennig (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2013

div.p: These Regulations make amendments to the Adoption Support Services (Local Authorities) (Wales) Regulations 2005 (“the Adoption Support Regulations”) and the Special Guardianship (Wales) Regulations 2005 (“the Special Guardianship Regulations”).

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud diwygiadau i Reoliadau Gwasanaethau Cymorth Mabwysiadu (Awdurdodau Lleol) (Cymru) 2005 (“y Rheoliadau Cymorth Mabwysiadu”) a Rheoliadau Gwarcheidiaeth Arbennig (Cymru) 2005 (“y Rheoliadau Gwarcheidiaeth Arbennig”).

entry.title: The Designation of Schools having a Religious Character (England) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order designates the voluntary or foundation schools named in the Order as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) and (4) of the Schools Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Electricity (Necessary Wayleaves and Felling and Lopping of Trees) (Hearing Procedures) (England and Wales) Rules 2013

ukm:Subject.Value: TRIBUNALS AND INQUIRIES, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: TRIBUNALS AND INQUIRIES, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: The Secretary of State has power to grant a necessary wayleave to enable an electricity company to install and keep installed an electric line on, under or over any land in accordance with paragraph 6(1) of Schedule 4 to the Electricity Act 1989 (c.29) (“the 1989 Act”). Before granting the necessary wayleave, the Secretary of State must afford the owner or occupier of the land an opportunity of being heard (paragraph 6(5) of Schedule 4). Where a tree or shrub is in close proximity to an electric line, the Secretary of State may also make an order to empower an electricity company to cause the tree or shrub to be felled or lopped and to determine the compensation to be paid (paragraph 9(6) of Schedule 4). Before making such an order the Secretary of State must give the parties an opportunity of being heard.

entry.title: The Fishing Boats (Satellite-Tracking Devices) Scheme (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: This Scheme makes provision for the payment of grants towards the cost of the purchase of satellite-tracking devices together with a 3-year warranty and their installation on board Northern Ireland sea fishing boats over 12 metres in length.

entry.title: The Charities Act 2008 (Transitional Provision) Order (Northern Ireland) 2013
Act of Sederunt (Summary Applications, Statutory Applications and Appeals etc. Rules Amendment) (Policing and Crime Act 2009) 2013
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Summary Application Rules in consequence of the amendments made to the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 by the Policing and Crime Act 2009. In particular, it inserts new rule3.19.20A, which provides for applications to the sheriff under section127N of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Discharge, variation and lapse of detention order) to be made by minute in the process of the application to extend the detention order. It also inserts rule 3.19.20B, which specifies the procedure for appealing to the Court of Session under sections127O (appeals against further detention or discharge or variation of detention order) and 131C (appeals in relation to property seized under section131A).

entry.title: The Port Security (Port of Sullom Voe) Designation Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order is one of a series of Orders implementing Directive 2005/65/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26th October 2005 (OJ L 310, 25.11.2005, p28-39) on enhancing port security at individual ports in the United Kingdom. The Directive was transposed in relation to the United Kingdom as a whole by the Port Security Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/2048).

entry.title: The Port Security (Port of Hull, New Holland, Immingham and Grimsby) Designation Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order is one of a series of Orders implementing Directive 2005/65/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26th October 2005 (OJ L 310, 25.11.2005, p28-39) on enhancing port security at individual ports in the United Kingdom. The Directive was transposed in relation to the United Kingdom as a whole by the Port Security Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/2048).

entry.title: The Export Control (Syria Sanctions) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for certain trade restrictions against Syria and certain Syrian persons. The prohibitions apply to any person in the United Kingdom and United Kingdom persons, as defined in section 11 of the Export Control Act 2002(c. 28), wherever they are in the world.

title.div: The Marine Navigation Act 2013 (Commencement) (Wales) Order 2013 / Gorchymyn Deddf Mordwyaeth 2013 (Cychwyn) (Cymru) 2013

div.p: This Order brings into force sections 5 and 6 of the Marine Navigation Act 2013 (c.23) (“the 2013 Act”) in relation to fishery harbours in Wales.
Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn adrannau 5 a 6 o Ddeddf Mordwyaeth 2013 (p.23) (“Deddf 2013”) i rym mewn perthynas â harbyrau pysgodfeydd yng Nghymru.

title.div: The Mumbles Oyster Fishery Order 2013 / Gorchymyn Pysgodfa Wystrys y Mwmbwls 2013

div.p: This Order confers on the Mumbles Oyster Company Limited (Company Number: 08181012) (“the Grantee”) a right of several fishery for native oysters (Ostrea edulis) over an area of approximately 35 hectares in Swansea Bay which is in the vicinity of the Mumbles for a period of 15 years starting on 10 September 2013.

Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhoi i Mumbles Oyster Company Limited (Rhif y Cwmni: 08181012) (“y Grantî”) yr hawl i bysgodfa unigol am wystrys brodorol (Ostrea edulis) dros arwynebedd o tua 35 hectar ym Mae Abertawe sydd yng nghyffiniau’r Mwmbwls, am gyfnod o 15 mlynedd yn dechrau ar 10 Medi 2013.

entry.title: The Access to Justice (Membership of the Northern Ireland Legal Services Commission) Order (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: This Order amends Article 4(1)(b) of the Access to Justice (Northern Ireland) Order 2003, which prescribes the minimum and maximum number of members (other than the chair) of the Northern Ireland Legal Services Commission.

entry.title: The Electricity (Necessary Wayleaves and Felling and Lopping of Trees) (Charges) (England and Wales) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations apply in respect of England and Wales.

title.div: The Healthy Eating in Schools (Nutritional Standards and Requirements) (Wales) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Bwyta’n Iach mewn Ysgolion (Gofynion a Safonau Maeth) (Cymru) 2013

div.p: These Regulations apply to local authorities and governing bodies of maintained schools that provide food and drink to pupils of maintained schools, whether they are on school premises or not, and to other persons on school premises.

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys i awdurdodau lleol a chyrff llywodraethu ysgolion a gynhelir sy’n darparu bwyd a diod i ddisgyblion ysgolion a gynhelir, p’un a ydynt ar fangre ysgol ai peidio, ac i bersonau eraill ar fangre ysgol.

title.div: The Healthy Eating in Schools (Wales) Measure 2009 (Commencement) Order 2013 / Gorchymyn Mesur Bwyta’n Iach mewn Ysgolion (Cymru) 2009 (Cychwyn) 2013

div.p: This Order brings into force the Healthy Eating in Schools (Wales) Measure 2009 (“the 2009 Measure”).
Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym Fesur Bwyta’n Iach mewn Ysgolion (Cymru) 2009 (“Mesur 2009”).

entry.title: The Council Tax Reduction (Scotland) Amendment (No. 3) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Council Tax Reduction (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Regulations 2013 to correct an error in a reference to earlier Regulations.
